alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 8:42AM PST until March 11 at 11:45AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 AM PST, gauge reports indicated elevated stream levels resulting in small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in Mark West and Santa Rosa Creek . - Mark West and Santa Rosa Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp and Forestville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
